text: Ángela Margarita Jeria Gómez (22 August 1926 – 2 July 2020) was a Chilean archaeologist and human rights activist. She was born in Talca, Chile. She was the mother of the President of Chile Michelle Bachelet. She was the wife of the Brigadier-general of the Chilean Air Force Alberto Bachelet. Jeria was known as the first lady during her daughter's the first government because she was not married. Jeria died at a military hospital in Santiago de Chile on 2 July 2020, aged 93. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Writers from Santiago Category:Chilean human rights activists Category:Archaeologists
